title: travis: Adjust DATALAD_REPO_VERSION in light of auto-upgrades

labels.name: severity-minor
labels.description: a problem which doesn't affect the package's usefulness, and is presumably trivial to fix

body:
This issue is being split off from gh-2969, specifically this comment by @bpoldrack:

> Subsequently we should also change the Travis builds, so they don't suggest to test sth, they actually do not test.

---

The .travis.yml in master sets `DATALAD_REPO_VERSION` to 5 and 6, but, with the minimum git-annex version on master (7.20190503), v6 will get auto-upgraded to the v7.  So, as of now, it makes sense to move the `DATALAD_REPO_VERSION=6` runs to `=7`.

And when neurodebian's git-annex (i.e. what we test with on Travis) is at least 7.20190912, v5 will also auto-upgrade to v7.  I think this becomes a little tricky because, if our minimum git-annex version doesn't auto-upgrade, we'll want to still have a run that tests v5 repos.  So we'd either need to add a run that gets an older git-annex from somewhere else or bump the minimum required version.

Once the minimum git-annex version is above 7.20190912, we should still make sure that we have AnnexRepo tests that cover the auto-upgrading (I think we already do), but I don't see any reason we need dedicated runs for different `DATALAD_REPO_VERSION` (which means we can drop two builds from the matrix).
